original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person is Upacelā.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
translated: The affliction is desire.

original: nyes pa ni spags pa slong pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni spags pa slong pa'o //
translated: The misdeed is the request for something of high quality.

original: de la dge slong gi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dge slong gi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In regard to that, “for a monk” means

original: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: for the Śākya boy Upāli,

analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or for anyone else like him.

original: khyim bdag gam zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gam zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'o //
translated: “A householder” is a man.

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do //
translated: “The householder’s wife” is a woman.

translated: “Not a relative” means that relatives are those up to and including the seventh generation of grandparents and great-grandparents, and those beyond that are not relatives.

analyzed: gos kyi rin dag ces bya ba ni gser ram dngul lo //

analyzed: bdag gis gos kyi rin 'di dag gis zhes bya ba ni gser ram dngul la sogs pa gang dag spags pa dag gis so //
translated: “With these prices of cloth” means with whatever gold, silver, and so on have been bartered.

analyzed: gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig ces bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase this kind of robe refers to any of the seven kinds of robes: woolen robes, linen robes, cotton robes, silk robes, fine linen robes, fine cotton robes, and fine silk robes.

original: nyos la zhes bya ba ni nyos te'o //
analyzed: nyos la zhes bya ba ni nyos te'o //
translated: The phrase having bought it means having purchased it.🔽The phrase this monk refers to the monk who is the messenger.

original: dge slong 'di dang 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs dang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /🔽gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'di dang 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs dang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am / gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase having come means having arrived.🔽The phrase I will give it to him means I will give it to this monk.

analyzed: de la gos rung ba dus su bskon no snyam pa las zhes bya ba ni longs spyod par bzod pa'o //
translated: The phrase at the proper time means at a time when it is suitable to use it.

original: de na gal te dge slong de la sngar ma bstabs par zhes bya ba ni sngar mgron du ma bos par ro //
analyzed: de na gal te dge slong de la sngar ma bstabs par zhes bya ba ni sngar mgron du ma bos par ro //
translated: The phrase if that monk has not previously been invited means if that monk has not previously been asked to accept the gift.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung ste zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur byed pa 'ga' zhig byung ste'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung ste zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur byed pa 'ga' zhig byung ste'o //
translated: The phrase if some idea occurs to him means if some thought occurs to him.

original: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase because he desires something good means because he desires something fine.

original: rab dang mchog 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab dang mchog 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he wants the best and the finest.

original: khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa de'i gan du song nas zhes bya ba ni drung du song nas so //
analyzed: khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa de'i gan du song nas zhes bya ba ni drung du song nas so //
translated: If he goes to that non-relative householder or householder’s wife,

analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pas bdag gi phyir gos kyi rin gang dag spags pa'i /
translated: he should say, “Venerable, the price of cloth that you have set aside for me,

analyzed: gos kyi rin de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig nyos la zhes bya ba ni gcig nyos te'o //
translated: with that price of cloth, buy such-and-such cloth for me,

analyzed: bdag la gos rung ba dus su legs par bskon cig ces smras te zhes bya ba ni spags pa slod pa'i tshig de skad ces smras te'o //
translated: and give it to me when it is the right time for me to have cloth.”

original: gos grub na zhes bya ba ni gos thob na'o //🔽spang @91b pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gos grub na zhes bya ba ni gos thob na'o // spang @91b pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If the cloth is finished,🔽he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: de la spags pa slong ba'i spong ba 'di ni /
analyzed: de la spags pa slong ba'i spong ba 'di ni /
translated: The offense is to be relinquished and confessed in the same way as above.🔽The training rule on asking for more, the first, is finished.

original: sngar slong ba'i spang pa bshad pa'i rab tu dbye bar gyur pa yin pas mtshan nyid gzhan thams cad ni sngar slong ba spang ba'i skabs su bstan pa kho na bzhin no //🔽bye brag tu na sbyin bdag gang yang rung bas spags kyang rung ma spags kyang rung ba dge slong gis mi shes pa slong ba ni slong ba'i spang ba sngar bstan pa'i yul yin la /

translated: Since this is a subdivision of the former, the training rule on receiving, all other characteristics are just as they are taught in the context of the training rule on receiving.🔽In particular, a monk does not know whether a donor has offered or not offered, and he begs for it. This is the object of the former training rule on receiving.

original: sbyin bdag spungs chung dus spyi la spags pa dge slong la ma phul ba dge slong des shes pa slong ba ni sbags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i 'di'i yul yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag spungs chung dus spyi la spags pa dge slong la ma phul ba dge slong des shes pa slong ba ni sbags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i 'di'i yul yin no //
translated: A monk knows that a donor has offered a small amount to the general community, but the monk has not been offered it. He begs for it. This is the object of the training rule on receiving what has been offered.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the presentation of the actual downfall is as follows.

original: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / brlag pa dang tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar ma gyur pa slong bar mi rigs pas mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa las gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rin thang dang
analyzed: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / brlag pa dang tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar ma gyur pa slong bar mi rigs pas mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa las gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rin thang dang
translated: It is not right to request robes from a human being who is not a relative, who is not a monastic, who is not a renunciate, who is not a fully ordained monk, who has not given a robe, who has not lost a robe, who has not burned a robe, who has not had a robe carried off by the wind, and who has not had a robe carried off by water.

original: / kha dog dang / khru tshad las rnam pa gang bslangs pa de nyid thob na /
analyzed: / kha dog dang / khru tshad las rnam pa gang bslangs pa de nyid thob na /
translated: If one obtains the very robe that one requested,

original: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then the actual basis of the downfall of requesting a robe is complete.

original: 'di'i byed pa po yang mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po yang mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa /
translated: The agent of this downfall is a human being who is not a monastic,

original: srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa'o //
translated: who is not a renunciate, who is not a fully ordained monk, who is not a relative, and who is alive.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual basis of this downfall is complete when five factors are present.

original: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / brlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar ma gyur pa slong bar mi rigs ba dang / sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa /
analyzed: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / brlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar ma gyur pa slong bar mi rigs ba dang / sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa /
translated: The donor must be a human being, a layperson,

original: srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa dang / gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa dang / rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad las spags pa ma phul bar shes par pa rnam pa gang bslangs pa dang /
analyzed: srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa dang / gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba spags pa ma phul bar shes pa dang / rin thang dang kha dog dang khru tshad las spags pa ma phul bar shes par pa rnam pa gang bslangs pa dang /
translated: and not a relative. The robe must be suitable, of the right measure, and not less than that. The monk must not know that the robe has not been offered, or that it has been offered but is not the right value, color, or size.

original: de nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid thob pa'o //
translated: The robe must be obtained from that very person.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these conditions are not fulfilled, the offense is a minor one.

original: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: This was the rule on requesting a robe.

original: // / so so nas spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
analyzed: // / so so nas spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na /
translated: The origin of the rule prohibiting requesting individual items🔽The Blessed Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī.

original: rgyal @92a * //
analyzed: rgyal @92a * //
translated: The Buddha

original: byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: He was staying in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: mnyan yod na khyim bdag gza' bran gnyis shig 'dod pa la log par spyod pa /
analyzed: mnyan yod na khyim bdag gza' bran gnyis shig 'dod pa la log par spyod pa /
translated: In Śrāvastī there were two brothers, householders, who were engaging in sexual misconduct.

original: bu mo mngag gzhug ma zhig yod pa rtag tu brdegs nas /
analyzed: bu mo mngag gzhug ma zhig yod pa rtag tu brdegs nas /
translated: They had a servant girl who was always being beaten.

original: nye dags de tshor nas khyim bdag gza' bran gnyis ci nas skyang skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod cing /
analyzed: nye dags de tshor nas khyim bdag gza' bran gnyis ci nas skyang skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar tshul khrims kyi bsngags pa brjod cing /
translated: Upasena heard about this and he praised morality in such a way that the two brothers went for refuge and abided in the bases of training.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i bsngags pa ma yin pa yang brjod nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i bsngags pa ma yin pa yang brjod nas /
translated: He also criticized immorality.

original: des de gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par byas so //
analyzed: des de gnyis skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la gnas par byas so //
translated: He caused them to go for refuge and abide in the bases of training.

original: de phyin chad de gnyis bu mo de la yang mi rdeg cing /
analyzed: de phyin chad de gnyis bu mo de la yang mi rdeg cing /
translated: From then on they did not beat the girl.🔽Upasena was invited to accept a fine woolen cloth from each of them. The girl heard about this

original: nye dga' la yang so so nas ras yug chen re re dbul bar glengs pa bu mo des thos nas /
analyzed: nye dga' la yang so so nas ras yug chen re re dbul bar glengs pa bu mo des thos nas /
translated: and she thought,

original: nye dga' la sbran pa dang / nye dga' der 'ongs te /
analyzed: nye dga' la sbran pa dang / nye dga' der 'ongs te /
translated: He complained to Upāli, and Upāli came there.🔽He had them each offer a bolt of cloth, but he rejected it. He had them each buy a good bolt of cloth from the market and offer it.

original: so so nas ras yug chen re re dbul bar byas pa bdas pa phul ba dang / des ma mgu ste tshong 'dus nas so so nas ras yug chen bzang po re re nyos te 'bul du bcug pa'i rin dus su ma 'khor nas /
analyzed: so so nas ras yug chen re re dbul bar byas pa bdas pa phul ba dang / des ma mgu ste tshong 'dus nas so so nas ras yug chen bzang po re re nyos te 'bul du bcug pa'i rin dus su ma 'khor nas /
translated: The price was not paid on time,

original: bu lon pas khyim bdag de bzung ste /🔽nyi ma la btags nas smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: bu lon pas khyim bdag de bzung ste / nyi ma la btags nas smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and the moneylender seized the householder.🔽He was tied to a sun-heated stone and reviled.🔽He was ridiculed.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: He was slandered.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis so so nas spags pa slong ba dgag par dgongs nas snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis so so nas spags pa slong ba dgag par dgongs nas snga ma bzhin du /
translated: Then the Blessed One, thinking to prohibit the solicitation of individual gifts, as before,

original: dge slong gi phyir khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pas gos kyi rin so so ba dag spags nas /
analyzed: dge slong gi phyir khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pas gos kyi rin so so ba dag spags nas /
translated: said, “If a householder and a householder’s wife who are not relatives of a monk each provide the price of a piece of cloth

original: bdag cag gnyis kyis gos kyi rin so so ba 'di dag gis gos 'di dang 'di lta bu so so ba dag nyos la /
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis kyis gos kyi rin so so ba 'di dag gis gos 'di dang 'di lta bu so so ba dag nyos la /
translated: “We two will each buy a piece of cloth with the value of the cloth that we have each set aside.

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs dang bdag cag gnyis kyis so so nas /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs dang bdag cag gnyis kyis so so nas /
translated: When the monk named so-and-so comes, we two will each give him a piece of cloth.

original: de la gos rung ba dus su bskon no snyam pa las /
analyzed: de la gos rung ba dus su bskon no snyam pa las /
translated: We will each give him a suitable piece of cloth in a timely manner.”

original: de na gal te dge slong de la sngar ma bstabs par rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung ste /
analyzed: de na gal te dge slong de la sngar ma bstabs par rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung ste /
translated: If, in that case, the monk, without having informed them beforehand, should have some thought,

original: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir khyim bdag dang / khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa de dag gi gan du song nas /
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir khyim bdag dang / khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa de dag gi gan du song nas /
translated: and, because of wanting something nice, go to those householders, the head of the household and his wife who are not relations,

original: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gi phyir @92b gos kyi rin so so ba gang dag spags pa'i gos kyi rin so so ba de dag gis /
analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gi phyir @92b gos kyi rin so so ba gang dag spags pa'i gos kyi rin so so ba de dag gis /
translated: and say, “Venerables, the value of the cloth that you have each set aside for me🔽buy with the value of the cloth that you have each set aside

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gos 'di dang 'di lta bu so so ba dag nyos la gnyi ga 'dus te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gos 'di dang 'di lta bu so so ba dag nyos la gnyi ga 'dus te /
translated: a piece of cloth like this and like this.

original: bdag la gos rung ba cig dus su legs par bskon cig ces smras te /
analyzed: bdag la gos rung ba cig dus su legs par bskon cig ces smras te /
translated: When you have both gathered together, give me a suitable piece of cloth in a timely manner.”

original: gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If one obtains cloth, there is an offense of expiation.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person was Upasena.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
translated: The affliction was any one of the three.

original: nyes pa ni so so nas spags pa slong ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni so so nas spags pa slong ba'o //
translated: The offense is asking for each item separately.

original: de la dge slong gi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dge slong gi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this case, “for a monk” means

original: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: for the Śākya son Upasena

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or for anyone else like him.

original: khyim bdag dang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag dang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'o //
translated: “Householder” means a man.

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma zhes bya ba ni bud med do //
translated: “Householder’s wife” means a woman.

original: nye du ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not a relative” means

original: phyi mo dang mes po dang / phrugs kyi bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la /
analyzed: phyi mo dang mes po dang / phrugs kyi bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la /
translated: that relatives are those up to and including the seventh generation of grandparents and great-grandparents.

original: de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
translated: Those beyond that are not relatives.

original: gos kyi rin zhes bya ba ni gser ram dngul lo //
analyzed: gos kyi rin zhes bya ba ni gser ram dngul lo //
translated: “The price of cloth” means gold or silver.

original: so so bdag ces bya ba ni tha dad pa dag go //
analyzed: so so bdag ces bya ba ni tha dad pa dag go //
translated: “Separately” means individually.

original: spags nas zhes bya ba ni sta gon byas nas so //
analyzed: spags nas zhes bya ba ni sta gon byas nas so //
translated: “Having asked for” means having requested.

original: bdag cag gnyis kyis gos kyi rin so so ba 'di dag gis zhes bya ba ni gser ram dngul la sogs pa so so ba gang dag spags pa dag gis so //
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis kyis gos kyi rin so so ba 'di dag gis zhes bya ba ni gser ram dngul la sogs pa so so ba gang dag spags pa dag gis so //
translated: We two, each with our own money means with whatever individual gold, silver, etc. have been accumulated.

original: gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni bdun pa bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni bdun pa bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: This or that kind of cloth means any of the seven kinds of cloth: wool, silk, cotton, linen, jute, canvas, and animal hair.

original: so so ba dag ces bya ba ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: so so ba dag ces bya ba ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: Each means separately.

original: nyos la zhes bya ba ni nyos te'o //
analyzed: nyos la zhes bya ba ni nyos te'o //
translated: Having bought means having purchased.

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'ongs dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'ongs dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The monk named so-and-so, who has come means

original: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: the son of the Śākyas, Upāli, or anyone else like him.

original: bdag cag gnyis kyis so so nas de la gos rung ba dus su bskon no snyam pa las zhes bya ba ni longs spyad par bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis kyis so so nas de la gos rung ba dus su bskon no snyam pa las zhes bya ba ni longs spyad par bzod pa'o //
translated: We two, each with our own money, will give him suitable cloth at the right time means that we will give him what we can afford.

original: de na gal te dge slong de la sngar ma bstabs par zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: de na gal te dge slong de la sngar ma bstabs par zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: If a monk, without first being invited, should go to the house of an unrelated householder or householder’s wife, and then, because he has a certain thought, because he desires something nice,🔽and should say to them, “Please give such and such a piece of cloth to me,🔽for my use,” and then, because of that, should receive cloth, that monk should confess that downfall in the midst of the community.

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung ste zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur byed pa 'ga' zhig byung ste'o //🔽bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab dang mchog 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o // rnam par rtog pa 'ga' zhig byung ste zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur byed pa 'ga' zhig byung ste'o // bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab dang mchog 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the rule.🔽“Householder” means a householder or a householder’s wife who is not a relative.

original: khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa de dag gi gan du song nas zhes bya ba ni drung du @93a * //🔽song nas so //🔽'di skad ces tshe dang ldan bdag gis bdag gis phyir gos kyi rin so so ba gang dag spags pa'i gos kyi rin so so ba de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag gos 'di dang 'di lta bu so so ba dag nyos la zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma nye du ma yin pa de dag gi gan du song nas zhes bya ba ni drung du @93a * // song nas so // 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan bdag gis bdag gis phyir gos kyi rin so so ba gang dag spags pa'i gos kyi rin so so ba de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag gos 'di dang 'di lta bu so so ba dag nyos la zhes bya ba ni
translated: “To their house” means to their presence.🔽“Please give such and such a piece of cloth to me, for my use” means “Please give me this and that piece of cloth.”

original: / tha dad pa dag nyos de'o //
analyzed: / tha dad pa dag nyos de'o //
translated: “For my use” means “for my own use.”

original: gnyi ga 'dus te zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga tshogs te'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'dus te zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga tshogs te'o //
translated: “Both of them” means both of them together.

original: bdag la gos rung ba cig dus su legs par bskon cig ces smras te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag la gos rung ba cig dus su legs par bskon cig ces smras te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Please give me a suitable robe at the right time” means

original: so so nas spags pa slong ba'i tshig de skad ces smras te'o //
analyzed: so so nas spags pa slong ba'i tshig de skad ces smras te'o //
translated: he says these words to each of them, asking for a separate robe.

original: gos grub na zhes bya ba ni gos thob na'o //
analyzed: gos grub na zhes bya ba ni gos thob na'o //
translated: “If the robe is finished” means if the robe is obtained.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense of wrong conduct” is as explained above.

original: de la so so nas spags pa slong pa'i spang ba'i 'di ni sngar spags pa slong ba'i spang ba bshad pa'i rnam pa yin pas /
analyzed: de la so so nas spags pa slong pa'i spang ba'i 'di ni sngar spags pa slong ba'i spang ba bshad pa'i rnam pa yin pas /
translated: Here, this offense of asking for separate robes is a variation on the offense of asking for a robe that has already been given.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan thams cad ni sngar spags pa slong ba'i skabs su bstan pa kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan thams cad ni sngar spags pa slong ba'i skabs su bstan pa kho na bzhin no //
translated: All the other characteristics are exactly as they were explained in the section on asking for a robe that has already been given.

original: bye brag tu na sbyin bar byed pa'i spungs kyi bye brag las ltung ba tha dad par rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu na sbyin bar byed pa'i spungs kyi bye brag las ltung ba tha dad par rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The difference is that the offense is established by the difference in the quantity given.

original: sngar spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ni sbyin par byed pa khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma gnyi gas spyi la gos kyi rin cig spags pa sbungs chung ngu'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sngar spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ni sbyin par byed pa khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma gnyi gas spyi la gos kyi rin cig spags pa sbungs chung ngu'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The former prohibition against requesting woven cloth is established from the perspective of a householder or his wife who has woven cloth and set aside its price.

original: 'dir so so nas spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ni sbyin par byed pa khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma gnyi gas so so nas gos kyi rin spags pa spungs chen po'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag ste /🔽de ltar na slong ba'i spang ba dag /
analyzed: 'dir so so nas spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ni sbyin par byed pa khyim bdag dang khyim bdag gi chung ma gnyi gas so so nas gos kyi rin spags pa spungs chen po'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag ste / de ltar na slong ba'i spang ba dag /
translated: The latter prohibition against requesting woven cloth is established from the perspective of a householder or his wife who has set aside the price of cloth.

original: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba dang / so so nas spags pa slong ba'i spang ba la bye brag 'di yod de sbyin bdag gang yang rung bas spags kyang rung /
analyzed: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba dang / so so nas spags pa slong ba'i spang ba la bye brag 'di yod de sbyin bdag gang yang rung bas spags kyang rung /
translated: Thus there is a difference between the prohibition against requesting and the prohibition against requesting woven cloth and the prohibition against requesting woven cloth set aside separately.

original: ma spags kyang rung ba de dge slong gis mi shes pa slong ba ni slong ba'i yul yin la /
analyzed: ma spags kyang rung ba de dge slong gis mi shes pa slong ba ni slong ba'i yul yin la /
translated: Whether the donor has set aside the price or not, if a monk requests it without knowing, it is the object of the prohibition against requesting.

original: sbyin bdag spungs chung ngus spyi la spags pa dge slong la ma phul ba dge slong des shes pa slong ba ni spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i yul yin la /
analyzed: sbyin bdag spungs chung ngus spyi la spags pa dge slong la ma phul ba dge slong des shes pa slong ba ni spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'i yul yin la /
translated: The object abandoned by requesting a gift for the general community is a monk who requests a gift for the general community when a small donor has not offered it to the general community of monks and the monk knows this.

original: sbyin bdag sbungs chen pos so so nas spags pa dge slong la ma phul ba dge slong des shes pa slong ba ni so so nas spags pa slang ba'i spang ba'i yul yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag sbungs chen pos so so nas spags pa dge slong la ma phul ba dge slong des shes pa slong ba ni so so nas spags pa slang ba'i spang ba'i yul yin no //
translated: The object abandoned by requesting a gift for each individual is a monk who requests a gift for each individual when a large donor has not offered it to each individual monk and the monk knows this.

original: de la 'dir ni dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the actual basis of a downfall is as follows.

original: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / brlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar ma gyur pa slong @93b bar mi rigs pas sbyin par byed pa sbungs che ba mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa /
analyzed: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / brlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar ma gyur pa slong @93b bar mi rigs pas sbyin par byed pa sbungs che ba mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa /
translated: It is not right for a monk whose robes have been stolen, lost, burned, blown away by the wind, or carried away by water to request a gift from a generous donor who is a human being,

original: khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa las /
analyzed: khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa las /
translated: who is a layperson, who is alive, and who is not a relative.

original: gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba so so nas spags pa ma phul bar shes pa dag rin thang dang / kha dog dang khru tshad las rnam pa gang dag bslangs pa de dag nyid thob na /
analyzed: gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba so so nas spags pa ma phul bar shes pa dag rin thang dang / kha dog dang khru tshad las rnam pa gang dag bslangs pa de dag nyid thob na /
translated: The robe should be the right size, not smaller than the prescribed size, and made of cloth that is suitable.🔽The cloth should not be offered by the patron, but should be known to be bought with money given by the patron.🔽

original: so so nas spags pa slong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so nas spags pa slong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The actual basis of the downfall is to ask for a robe that is the right size and is not less than the right size, that is not offered, that one knows is not offered, and that is of a value and color and size that one has requested.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni sbyin par byed pa sbungs che ba mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni sbyin par byed pa sbungs che ba mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa'o //
translated: The agent is a monk who is not a relative of the donor, who is a human being, who is not a renunciate, and who is alive.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual basis of the downfall is completed by five factors:

original: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / brlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar ma gyur pa slong bar mi rigs pa dang / sbyin bdag sbungs che ba mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa /
analyzed: dge slong gos phrogs pa dang / brlag pa dang / tshig pa dang / rlung gis khyer ba dang / chus khyer bar ma gyur pa slong bar mi rigs pa dang / sbyin bdag sbungs che ba mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa /
translated: the monk is not one who has had his robe stolen, lost, burned, blown away by the wind, or carried away by water; the donor is a human being, a lay person, and a person of integrity;

original: srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa dang / gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba /
analyzed: srog dang ldan pa nye du ma yin pa dang / gos rung ba tshad dang ldan pa las mi chung ba /
translated: It is not a relative who has life, and it is not less than the proper measure of cloth.

original: so so nas spags pa ma phul bar shes pa dang / rin thang dang / kha dog dang / khru tshad las so so nas spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rnam pa gang bslangs pa dang / de nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: so so nas spags pa ma phul bar shes pa dang / rin thang dang / kha dog dang / khru tshad las so so nas spags pa ma phul bar shes pa rnam pa gang bslangs pa dang / de nyid thob pa'o //
translated: It is not a piece of cloth that is not offered by each of them, and it is not a piece of cloth that is not offered by each of them in terms of its value, color, or cubit measure.

original: yul mi 'am zhes bya ba ni yul gyi mi'o //🔽nor can nam zhes bya ba ni bye bas byug pa'o //🔽tshong dpon nam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul mi 'am zhes bya ba ni yul gyi mi'o // nor can nam zhes bya ba ni bye bas byug pa'o // tshong dpon nam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The people of the country” means the people of the country.🔽“The wealthy” means those who are anointed with wealth.

original: cod pa ni bcings pa'o //
analyzed: cod pa ni bcings pa'o //
translated: “The guild masters” means

original: ded dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni gang gis lan gnyis lan gsum 'don pa don mthun bdas par gyur bas so//

translated: “The caravan leaders” means those who lead the caravan twice or three times.

original: @95b pho nya'i lag tu zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning gi lag tu 'o //
analyzed: @95b pho nya'i lag tu zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang / bud med dang / ma ning gi lag tu 'o //
translated: “The messengers” means the hands of men, women, and eunuchs.

original: gos kyi rin dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos kyi rin dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: “The price of cloth” means

original: gser ram dngul dag bskur bar gyur la zhes bya ba ni bsring bar gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: gser ram dngul dag bskur bar gyur la zhes bya ba ni bsring bar gyur pa la'o //
translated: “Gold or silver” means that which is sent.

original: de nas pho nya de gos kyi rin de dag khyer nas /
analyzed: de nas pho nya de gos kyi rin de dag khyer nas /
translated: Then the messenger, having taken that price of cloth,🔽approaches the monk.

original: dge slong ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: dge slong ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Having approached,

original: dge slong de la 'di skad ces 'phags pa mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: dge slong de la 'di skad ces 'phags pa mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: he says this to the monk: “Noble one, please know that

original: khyod la rgyal po'am /
analyzed: khyod la rgyal po'am /
translated: either a king,

original: blon po chen po 'am /
analyzed: blon po chen po 'am /
translated: a great minister,

original: bram ze'am / khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: bram ze'am / khyim bdag gam /
translated: a brahmin, a householder,

original: khyim bdag gi chung ma'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma'am /
translated: a householder’s wife,🔽or a householder’s son

original: grong rdal gyi mi'am /🔽yul mi'am / nor can nam /
analyzed: grong rdal gyi mi'am / yul mi'am / nor can nam /
translated: a town-dweller,🔽a country-dweller,

original: tshong dpon nam /🔽ded dpon tshe ge mos gos kyi rin 'di dag bskur gyis /
analyzed: tshong dpon nam / ded dpon tshe ge mos gos kyi rin 'di dag bskur gyis /
translated: a wealthy person,🔽a guild-master,🔽a caravan leader, or a messenger, saying, ‘This is the price of cloth.

original: 'phags pas thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag bzhes shig ces zer na zhes bya ba ni pho nya dge slong dag la sbyin bdag gis gos kyi rin bskur ba dag phul nas phrin de skad ces smras na'o //
analyzed: 'phags pas thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag bzhes shig ces zer na zhes bya ba ni pho nya dge slong dag la sbyin bdag gis gos kyi rin bskur ba dag phul nas phrin de skad ces smras na'o //
translated: Out of compassion for me, Noble One, please accept it.’

original: dge slong des pho nya de la 'di skad ches tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong dag gi ni gos kyi rin dag len du mi rung ste /
analyzed: dge slong des pho nya de la 'di skad ches tshe dang ldan pa pho nya dge slong dag gi ni gos kyi rin dag len du mi rung ste /
translated: If the messenger monk says to that person, ‘Venerable messenger, it is not suitable for monks to accept the price of cloth.

original: bdag cag gos rung ba dus su rnyed na ni len to zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag cag gos rung ba dus su rnyed na ni len to zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If we get suitable cloth at the right time, we will accept it,’🔽he should say that.

original: dge slong dag dngos po mi rung bar rung bar ma byas pa dag mi len pa dang / gos rung ba dus su rnyed pa len du rung ba'i tshul go bar byas te gos kyi rin dag ni gser dang dngul la sogs pa mi rung ba rung bar ma byas pa dag go //
analyzed: dge slong dag dngos po mi rung bar rung bar ma byas pa dag mi len pa dang / gos rung ba dus su rnyed pa len du rung ba'i tshul go bar byas te gos kyi rin dag ni gser dang dngul la sogs pa mi rung ba rung bar ma byas pa dag go //
translated: The price of robes is unsuitable, but is made suitable by gold, silver, etc.

original: gos rung ba ni spyad bzod ba dag go //🔽dus su rnyed pa ni gos bged pa'i dus su /
analyzed: gos rung ba ni spyad bzod ba dag go // dus su rnyed pa ni gos bged pa'i dus su /
translated: Suitable robes are those that can be used.🔽Obtained in a timely manner means obtained at the time of distributing robes,

original: slong bar rigs pa'i dus dang / bstabs pa'i dus su rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: slong bar rigs pa'i dus dang / bstabs pa'i dus su rnyed pa'o //
translated: at the time of begging, or at the time of giving.

original: len to zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byed do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: len to zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byed do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Accept means make them one's own.

original: de skad ces brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces brjod bar bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be expressed.

original: gal te pho nya de dge slong de la 'di skad ces 'phags pa rnams kyi zhal ta bgyid pa /
analyzed: gal te pho nya de dge slong de la 'di skad ces 'phags pa rnams kyi zhal ta bgyid pa /
translated: If that messenger says to that monk, 'Noble one, the service of the noble ones

original: 'phags pa rnams gyi zhal te nyams su len pa gang lags pa 'ga' mchis sam zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni pho nya dag slong rnams kyi rung bar byed pa su yod ces brtag pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams gyi zhal te nyams su len pa gang lags pa 'ga' mchis sam zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni pho nya dag slong rnams kyi rung bar byed pa su yod ces brtag pa ste /
translated: If someone asks, Are there any who are the mouths, that is, the practitioners, of the noble ones?🔽 The messengers are inquiring, Who is suitable to be the manager of the monks?

original: zhal ta bgyid pa zhes bya ba dag la zhal ta nyams su len pa zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: zhal ta bgyid pa zhes bya ba dag la zhal ta nyams su len pa zhes bya ba ni bsnan pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The phrase the manager is a compound word.

original: gzhi gcig tu bsdu'o //🔽dge slong gis gos 'dod pas pho nya 'di ni dge slong rnams kyi zhal ta byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi gcig tu bsdu'o // dge slong gis gos 'dod pas pho nya 'di ni dge slong rnams kyi zhal ta byed pa ste /
translated: It is included in one basis.

original: @96a * // 'di ni dge slong rnams kyi zhal ta nyams su len pa'o zhes kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
analyzed: @96a * // 'di ni dge slong rnams kyi zhal ta nyams su len pa'o zhes kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
translated: If a monk desires cloth, he should point out to the caretaker of the monastery or the caretaker of the monks, saying, This is the manager of the monks,🔽 this is the practitioner of the manager of the monks.

original: dge bsnyen zhal ta byed pa bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis dge slong rnams kyi rung bar byed pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen zhal ta byed pa bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis dge slong rnams kyi rung bar byed pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is pointing out the manager of the monks by a monk.

original: dge slong gos 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gos 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a monk desires cloth,

original: gal te gos don du gnyer bas so //
analyzed: gal te gos don du gnyer bas so //
translated: if he is seeking cloth.🔽

original: kun dga' ra ba pa zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen zhal ta byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha dad de /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba pa zhes bya ba dang / dge bsnyen zhal ta byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha dad de /
translated: The term “monk in charge of the monastery” is different from the term “lay practitioner who is in charge.”

original: gnyi ga yang zhal ta byed pa dang / zhal ta nyams su len pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhal ta byed pa dang / zhal ta nyams su len pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Both terms refer to someone who is in charge and who is engaged in the practice of the duties.

original: de la kun dga' ra ba pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la kun dga' ra ba pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “monk in charge of the monastery” refers to

original: rung ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba byed pa ste /
translated: someone who is qualified to perform the duties.

original: lha 'bangs dang rtse rgod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha 'bangs dang rtse rgod la sogs pa'o //
translated: This includes such people as the royal servant and the royal servant’s son.

original: dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni gsum la skyabs su song ba bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blangs pa ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni gsum la skyabs su song ba bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blangs pa ste /
translated: The term “lay practitioner” refers to someone who has gone for refuge to the Three Jewels and who has taken up the five precepts.

original: dge slong gi 'khor du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor du gtogs pa'o //
translated: This person is included in the retinue of monks.

original: de nas pho nya des gos kyi rin de dag khyer nas /
analyzed: de nas pho nya des gos kyi rin de dag khyer nas /
translated: Then, the messenger, having taken those goods that are the price of the robe,🔽should go to the monk who is in charge.

original: zhal ta byed pa de ga la ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas zhal ta byed pa de la /
analyzed: zhal ta byed pa de ga la ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas zhal ta byed pa de la /
translated: Having arrived, he should say this to the monk who is in charge:

original: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis gos kyi rin 'di dag gis gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig nyos la /
analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa shes par gyis shig / khyod kyis gos kyi rin 'di dag gis gos 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig nyos la /
translated: “Venerable one who is in charge, please know that you should buy such and such a robe with these goods that are the price of the robe.

original: dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs dang de la gos rung ba dus su bskon cig ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba 'ongs dang de la gos rung ba dus su bskon cig ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The messenger should say, The monk named so-and-so will come. Give him suitable robes at the right time.

original: pho nyas gos kyi ri na dag zhal ta byed pa la gtad cing /
analyzed: pho nyas gos kyi ri na dag zhal ta byed pa la gtad cing /
translated: This is the statement of entrusting the messenger to the attendant with the robe fund,

original: de dag gos rung bar sgyur la dge slong de la dus su phul cig ces gtams shing rjes su bstan pa'i tshig yin no //🔽de nas pho nya des zhal ta byed pa de la /
analyzed: de dag gos rung bar sgyur la dge slong de la dus su phul cig ces gtams shing rjes su bstan pa'i tshig yin no // de nas pho nya des zhal ta byed pa de la /
translated: and the statement of instruction to make the robes suitable and give them to the monk at the right time.

original: shin tu legs par yang dag par bsgo zhing yang dag par bstan nas dge slong de ga la ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas /
analyzed: shin tu legs par yang dag par bsgo zhing yang dag par bstan nas dge slong de ga la ba der 'gro bar bya zhing phyin nas /
translated: Then the messenger, having instructed and taught the attendant very well, should go to where the monk is. Having arrived,

original: dge slong de la 'di skad ces 'phags pas zhal ta bgyid ba bstan pa gang lags pa de la bdag gis yang dag par bstan lags kyis /
analyzed: dge slong de la 'di skad ces 'phags pas zhal ta bgyid ba bstan pa gang lags pa de la bdag gis yang dag par bstan lags kyis /
translated: he should say to the monk, The noble one has shown me the attendant. I have instructed him well.

original: de'i gan du bzhud cig dang / des khyod la gos rung ba dus su bskon par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i gan du bzhud cig dang / des khyod la gos rung ba dus su bskon par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Go to him and he will give you suitable robes at the right time.

original: yid gcugs pa'i tshig gis sngar mngon sum gtugs pa'i don gyi phyir rjes su go bar bya ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: yid gcugs pa'i tshig gis sngar mngon sum gtugs pa'i don gyi phyir rjes su go bar bya ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The words of a trustworthy person are words that are understood subsequently for the sake of a matter that has already been directly experienced.

original: dge slong gos 'dod pas zhal ta byed pa'i gan du song la /
analyzed: dge slong gos 'dod pas zhal ta byed pa'i gan du song la /
translated: A monk who desires cloth should approach the robe-making assigner and say,

original: tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do //
translated: “Venerable robe-making assigner, I desire cloth.”

original: tshe dang @96b ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul bar bya /
analyzed: tshe dang @96b ldan pa zhal ta byed pa bdag gos 'dod do zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul bar bya /
translated: He should remind him a second and a third time.

original: dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: “He should remember” means that a monk should act in a way that does not contradict the world and does not contradict the training.

original: lan cig gis grub na gnyis bya mi dgos /
analyzed: lan cig gis grub na gnyis bya mi dgos /
translated: If it is accomplished by one reminder, a second is not necessary.

original: gnyis pas grub na gsum bya mi dgos /
analyzed: gnyis pas grub na gsum bya mi dgos /
translated: If it is accomplished by two reminders, a third is not necessary.

original: gnyis pas ma grub na gsum pa yang bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pas ma grub na gsum pa yang bya ste /
translated: If it is not accomplished by two reminders, a third should be done.

original: re zhig de dag ni dus dang por bya ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni dus dang por bya ba yin no //
translated: These are the first things to be done.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul zhing dran par byas pa na /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du bskul zhing dran par byas pa na /
translated: When he has reminded him a second and a third time,

original: gal te gos de grub na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ba ste /
analyzed: gal te gos de grub na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ba ste /
translated: If the robe is made, it is good.

original: sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa la yang btang ba las byung ba dang / yongs su longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sbyin bdag dang pho nya dang zhal ta byed pa la yang btang ba las byung ba dang / yongs su longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, the basis of merit that arises from giving and the basis of merit that arises from enjoyment increase for the patron, the messenger, and the attendant.

original: dge slong la yang 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong la yang 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And for the monk, there is no offense that contradicts the world or contradicts the Vinaya.

original: gal te ma grub na lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar spyad pa'i cho ga yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma grub na lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal bar spyad pa'i cho ga yin no //
translated: If the robe is not made, he should remain silent in that direction for four, five, or six times.

original: phyogs su zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi po dag ste /
analyzed: phyogs su zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi po dag ste /
translated: In that direction means in the four directions.

original: phyogs bzhi po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four directions?

original: 'bod gnas dang / khyim gnas dang / las kyi mtha' dang / las kyi gnas dag go //
analyzed: 'bod gnas dang / khyim gnas dang / las kyi mtha' dang / las kyi gnas dag go //
translated: the place of calling, the place of the house, the place of work, and the place of activity.

original: de la 'bod gnas ni /
analyzed: de la 'bod gnas ni /
translated: The place of calling is

original: rdza mkhan gyi gnas dang 'dreg mkhan gyi gnas so //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi gnas dang 'dreg mkhan gyi gnas so //
translated: the place of the potter and the place of the barber.

original: khyim gnas ni khyim gyi gnas sam chu'i gnas so //
analyzed: khyim gnas ni khyim gyi gnas sam chu'i gnas so //
translated: The place of the house is the place of the house or the place of water.

original: las kyi mtha' ni bu ram shing gi las kyi mtha' dang / 'bras s'a lu'i las kyi mtha' dang / lan tshva'i las kyi mtha' dag go //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ni bu ram shing gi las kyi mtha' dang / 'bras s'a lu'i las kyi mtha' dang / lan tshva'i las kyi mtha' dag go //
translated: The place of work is the place of work of sugarcane, the place of work of rice, and the place of work of salt.

original: las kyi gnas ni tshong khang dang / tshong rdal lo //
analyzed: las kyi gnas ni tshong khang dang / tshong rdal lo //
translated: The place of activity is the shop and the market.

original: cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag gis te /
analyzed: cang mi smra bar bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag gis te /
translated: One should remain silent.🔽The six doors of urging are:🔽When asked, “Have you come?” one should say, “For that reason.”🔽When asked, “Welcome!” one should say, “For that reason.”

original: bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag gang zhe na khyod 'ongs sam zhes zer bal de'i phyir ro zer ba dang / 'ongs pa legs so zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / stan 'di la 'dug shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag gang zhe na khyod 'ongs sam zhes zer bal de'i phyir ro zer ba dang / 'ongs pa legs so zhes zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / stan 'di la 'dug shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang /
translated: When asked, “Sit on this seat!” one should say, “For that reason.”

original: rkang pa khrus shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / bca' ba dang bza' ba zo shig ces zer ba la de'i @97a * //
analyzed: rkang pa khrus shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / bca' ba dang bza' ba zo shig ces zer ba la de'i @97a * //
translated: When asked, Why? he replies, It is for the sake of eating the food and drink.

original: phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / btung ba 'thung shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / btung ba 'thung shig ces zer ba la de'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When asked, Why? he replies, It is for the sake of drinking the drink.

original: bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag ha cang myur ba dang / thogs pa med par brjod cing de la gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med par byed na bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag ha cang myur ba dang / thogs pa med par brjod cing de la gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med par byed na bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If he speaks very quickly and without hesitation, and does not allow an opportunity for others to speak, then the six doors of exhortation are known to be incomplete.

original: bskul ba'i sgo drug po de dag ha cang mi myur ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas par brjod cing de la gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs yod par byed na /
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo drug po de dag ha cang mi myur ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas par brjod cing de la gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs yod par byed na /
translated: If he speaks not too quickly and with hesitation, and allows an opportunity for others to speak,

original: bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag yongs su rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo drug po dag yongs su rdzogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: then the six doors of exhortation are known to be complete.

original: lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad pa na /
analyzed: lan bzhi lan lnga lan drug gi bar du phyogs su cang mi smra bar bsdad pa na /
translated: Up to four, five, or six times, he remains silent in that direction.

original: gal te gos de grub na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te gos de grub na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the robe is made, it is good.

original: dge slong la 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i kha na mtho ba'i dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba yang med la /
analyzed: dge slong la 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i kha na mtho ba'i dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba yang med la /
translated: If the monk has no offense that is a basis in the Monastic Code, no offense that is a grave offense, and no offense that is a serious offense,

original: sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta bdag la yang btang ba las byung ba dang / yongs su longs spyad pa la byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / zhal ta bdag la yang btang ba las byung ba dang / yongs su longs spyad pa la byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and if the donor, the messenger, and the patron increase the basis for merit that comes from giving and the basis for merit that comes from using,

original: gal te ma grub na de'i 'og tu bsgrub pa'i phyir brtsal te gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni ltung pa 'di'i byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma grub na de'i 'og tu bsgrub pa'i phyir brtsal te gos grub na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni ltung pa 'di'i byed pa po yin te /
translated: then if the robe is not made, he must make an effort to get it made. If the robe is made, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og rol du'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og rol du'o //
translated: “If it is not made” means if it is not made after that.

original: gos bsgrub pa'i phyir brtsal te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i 'dzem pa spangs nas so //
analyzed: gos bsgrub pa'i phyir brtsal te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i 'dzem pa spangs nas so //
translated: “If he makes an effort to get it made” means if he makes an effort to get it made after giving up his sense of shame, both that which is proper for the world and that which is proper for the Monastic Law.

original: gos grub na zhes bya ba ni thob na'o //
analyzed: gos grub na zhes bya ba ni thob na'o //
translated: “If he obtains” means if he acquires.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po de spangs nas ltung byed kyi ltung ba bshags par bya ba ste /
translated: “A downfall requiring confession” means that after giving up that object, he must confess a downfall that is a minor offense.

original: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called “a downfall requiring confession.”

original: da ni dus dang por bya ba dang / ltung ba med par bya ba'i cho ga sdar bstan pa de dag la tshul bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i ltung ba ma byung bas sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / dge slong rang nyid kyi 'dod pa bzhin ma grub par zhal ta byed pas /
analyzed: da ni dus dang por bya ba dang / ltung ba med par bya ba'i cho ga sdar bstan pa de dag la tshul bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i ltung ba ma byung bas sbyin bdag dang / pho nya dang / dge slong rang nyid kyi 'dod pa bzhin ma grub par zhal ta byed pas /
translated: Now, in order to show the proper way to live in accordance with the rules for the first part of the day and the rules for the proper conduct that are taught in the chapter on downfalls, a monk who has not committed a downfall in this training rule should, if the donor, the messenger, or the monk himself is not satisfied, not be discouraged about accomplishing the aims of this world and the next.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol gyi don la ma gzems par spyi mthun gyi rdzas dang / bsod nams bar du brnogs pa la dge slong gis chos bzhin du bsgrub pa'i cho ga bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol gyi don la ma gzems par spyi mthun gyi rdzas dang / bsod nams bar du brnogs pa la dge slong gis chos bzhin du bsgrub pa'i cho ga bstan par bya ste /
translated: He should teach the proper conduct for accomplishing things in accordance with the Dharma, without stealing the shared property and the merit.

original: @97b gal te ma grub na /
analyzed: @97b gal te ma grub na /
translated: If he is not satisfied,

original: gang nas gos kyi rin de dag 'ongs pa der bdag 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang nas gos kyi rin de dag 'ongs pa der bdag 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dge slong bdag nyid sbyin bdag gi drung du brda sprad du 'gro bar bya'o //

analyzed: yang na yid brtan pa'i pho nya las tshe dang ldan pa dag gis /

original: dge slong che ge mo'i phyir gos gyi rin gang dag bskur ba de dag ni dge slong de'i don cir yang ma grub kyis shes par gyis shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag gis rang gis nor chud ma gsan cig ces spring bar bya ste zhes bya ba🔽ni yang na lhan cig gnas pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong che ge mo'i phyir gos gyi rin gang dag bskur ba de dag ni dge slong de'i don cir yang ma grub kyis shes par gyis shig / tshe dang ldan pa dag gis rang gis nor chud ma gsan cig ces spring bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni yang na lhan cig gnas pa'am /

analyzed: nye gnas las de skad spring bar bya ste /

original: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs de la thabs de ltar bya ba de ni 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnams par gzhag pa ni /

original: dge slong gis sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pas gos kyi rin gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa pho nya mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim par gyur pa las bskur ba spangs nas /

translated: These are the five, three, and two bases of conflict, respectively, in terms of the afflictions of being very attached to using, the cause of using, and buying and selling.

analyzed: de la srin bal gyi spang ba'i gleng gzhi ni /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //

original: de'i tshe na dge slong dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug ste /

translated: Because silk is rare and valuable, they used a lot of it and had a lot made. They neglected to recite the scriptures, to read them, to chant them, to practice yoga, to pay attention, and to stay in their cells.

original: srin bal 'dod pa dang / srin bal gyi don nyid du 'ongs ba dag /
analyzed: srin bal 'dod pa dang / srin bal gyi don nyid du 'ongs ba dag /

analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams la yang dag yang du rig par byed nas / gzhan mu stegs can dag //
translated: They came to the brahmins and householders and said,

original: shes ldan dag /
analyzed: shes ldan dag /
translated: “Sirs,🔽these śramaṇas, sons of the Śākya,

analyzed: sh'a kya'i bu'i dge sbyong 'di dag ni srog gcod bar byed pa dag ste /

original: srog gcod pa la las ma log /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la las ma log /
translated: They do not refrain from killing,

original: ma spangs / so sor ma spangs pa ste /
analyzed: ma spangs / so sor ma spangs pa ste /
translated: have not given it up, and have not abandoned it.

original: des na srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: des na srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug ste /
translated: They make new bedding with kapok and have others make it.

original: de dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pas srin bal las 'byung ba'i srin bu srog chags mang po'i chogs bsgrub cing srog gcod par byed de /
analyzed: de dag srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa dang / byed du 'jug pas srin bal las 'byung ba'i srin bu srog chags mang po'i chogs bsgrub cing srog gcod par byed de /
translated: Because they make new bedding with kapok and have others make it, they kill many small creatures that live in the kapok.

original: su zhig dge sbyong mgo reg 'di dag la bsod snyoms sbyin pa dang / bya bar sems zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: su zhig dge sbyong mgo reg 'di dag la bsod snyoms sbyin pa dang / bya bar sems zhes smod par byed /
translated: Who would think of giving alms-food to these shaven-headed śramaṇas?🔽” They reviled them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽@98b kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽@98b kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: sneered at them,🔽and insulted them.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as before,

original: yang dge slong gang srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: formulated the rule: “Any monk who makes a new bed with silk must undergo penance.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po //

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /

analyzed: nyes pa ni srin bal gyi stan sar pa byed pa'o //

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //🔽srin bal gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o // srin bal gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this case, “any monk” means a monk in this Dharma.

original: dar gyi srin bu las byung ba'i srin bal gyi'o //
analyzed: dar gyi srin bu las byung ba'i srin bal gyi'o //

original: stan zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /
analyzed: stan zhes bya ba ni stan gnyis te /

analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa gnyis te /

analyzed: gsar pas sar ba dang / rnyed pas sar pa'o //

original: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gsar pas sar pa yin par dgongs so //

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If he makes” means

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o /

analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A downfall requiring relinquishment and confession” is as explained above.

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the basic downfall is defined as follows.

analyzed: dge slong gis srin bal sar pa'i chun po dang / 'da' ba dang / phung po las stan nang tshangs can nam /

analyzed: blings pa rang gis byas sam /
translated: whether he makes it himself or has someone else make it,

analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni srin bal sar pa'i stan nang tshangs can dang / blings pa tshad dang ldan pa dang / de bas lhag pa byed pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this downfall is one who makes a sitting mat of silk or cotton wadding that is of the right size or larger.

analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basic downfall is incurred through five factors.

analyzed: srin bal dang / sar pa dang / stan dang / byas pa dang / byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po bkram pa nyid do //

analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are incomplete, then the mat should be criticized as appropriate.

original: srin bal gyi spang ba ste bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: srin bal gyi spang ba ste bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the rule on cotton, the eleventh.

analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
